contest-event.event-date:
Jan. 27, 1935 D NSW State Championships (A Grade)
NSW State Championships (A Grade) 10 Sacred, March, Set Test and Own Choice Contest NSW State Championships nsw-state-championships-a-grade
Australia
A Grade
Sacred, March, Set Test and Own Choice Contest
Sydney Sports Ground, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia MUSIC 2 own choice selections Following the new rule introduced by the Australian Band Council ,In a first for Australian bands and possibly the world percussion instruments were included .at a contest The Own Choice Selection "Liszt " that the Bondi Beach Concert band played was an arrangement by Dr.Keightley, the same selection that bandmaster Albert Baile won with the Newcastle Steelworks at the Bellevue contest (Eng) 1924. They were the only band that took advantage of the new rule . It had a full set of tympani etc and played splendidly by Hayden Huckstepp (The above article appeared in the "Tempo Band Journal" Feb 1935)
Marching Championship (open grade ) ............Band .................Drum Major ...... March....... pts .1 Westmead Boys' Home , Bob Llewellyn , " Ravenswood "169 2. Westmead Old Boys' , George Annesley , "Non Pareil " 165 3. Burwood District " T. Rodham , "Mephistopheles " 160 4. Townsville Railway ( Qld) , A. Trembath , " The Red Gauntlet " 156 5. Bondi Beach Concert , Bob Llewellyn , " The Scindian " 155 6. North Sydney Tramway , G. Flowers , " 20th Century " 143 7. Randwick Municipal , Bob Llewellyn , " Albion "139
July 31, 2016, 11:45 p.m. Feb. 2, 2017, 5:30 a.m.
